newsitem.title: ITALY: Fiat Auto European sales grow in 1996.
newsitem.headline: Fiat Auto European sales grow in 1996.

text.p: Fiat Auto group's overall sales in Europe in 1996 totalled 1,430,602 vehicles, an increase of 97,000 on 1995, a company source said on Friday.
Sales outside Italy totalled 668,000, a rise of 22.3 percent in a European market, excluding Italy, which grew on average 7.5 percent.
Its share of the European market rose to 11.3 percent from 11.2 percent in 1995, consolidating at the level of other major carmakers behind the market leader Volkswagen.
In Germany, the Turin-based group's sales rose 25.6 percent with a market share up 5.7 percent, while in France its sales grew 40 percent and its share rose 10.5 percent.
In Britain, Fiat posted a 24.3 percent increase with a market share rising 4.0 percent.
At the end of 1996, Fiat had 630,000 orders for its Punto while the Bravo and Brava models, in their first full marketing year, saw European registrations of 300,000.
